text: Normal-weight subjects showed significant blood oxygen level-dependent responses in the ventromedial prefrontal cortex ( vmPFC ) to food aromas compared with responses induced by the odor of an inedible object .

PrEP is efficacious for HIV-1 prevention among women using DMPA and men whose partners use DMPA , suggesting PrEP could mitigate the potential increased HIV-1 acquisition and transmission risks that have been associated with DMPA use .
The SSM 30 g may be an effective , noninvasive alternative to health care provider-administered intravenous , intramuscular , or oral opioids for the management of moderate-to-severe acute pain .

Normal weight subjects showed significant blood oxygen-dependent reactions in the ventromedial prefrontal cortex (vmPFC) to food flavors compared to reactions caused by the odor of an inedible object.

PrEP is effective in preventing HIV-1 in women who use DMPA and men whose partners use DMPA, suggesting that PrEP could reduce the potential increased HIV-1 contagion and transmission risks associated with the use of DMPA.
The SSM 30 g can be an effective, non-invasive alternative to intravenous, intramuscular or oral opioids administered by a physician to treat moderate to severe acute pain.
